recordTypes.name: Accessory Apartment Permit
recordTypes.description: Please use this application to obtain or renew an Accessory Apartment zoning certificate in accordance with Section 24 of the Madison Zoning Regulations.

recordTypes.name: Planning & Zoning Commission Application
recordTypes.description: Please use this application for any submission to the Planning & Zoning Commission including Site Plan, Special Exception, Village District, Subdivision, Re-Subdivision, Text Amendment, and Zone Boundary Change.

recordTypes.name: Zoning Board of Appeals Application
recordTypes.description: Please use this application for Variances, Substitution of non-conforming uses, Modifications of Variances, and Appeals of ZEO's Decision

recordTypes.name: Inland Wetlands and Watercourses Agency Application (IWWA)
recordTypes.description: Please use this application for any regulated activities within a wetland or watercourse and the 100ft upland review area. This includes as of right determinations, non-regulated determinations, timber harvests, and text and boundary amendments.

recordTypes.name: Open Burn Permit
recordTypes.description: Burn Permits can be filled out prior to coming to the office to obtain a signature. Once permit is completed and the fee paid an inspection of the burn site will be conducted, from that day the permit will be good for fourteen (14 days). Once a permit issued the home owner MUST call (203) 245-2772 option "0" to obtain approval to burn for the day. Burning hours are from 10 AM - 5 PM on a clear day with AQI below 75 and fire danger moderate or low. Burn permits are required to be requested at least 7 days before date of issue.

recordTypes.name: Administrative Zoning Permit
recordTypes.description: Please use this permit application for home occupations, temporary and permanent signage, and small accessory structures under 200 sq.ft.

Welcome to our Online Permitting System.


In an effort to streamline the Town of Madison’s permitting process, the building permit has changed effective October 1, 2025. What’s changed? The permit types have been changed to be less confusing. Depending on your choice of permit type, additional fields will appear requiring more information. Below is a list for your reference.
